title: Permabanned? I haven't played in years!
body:
I thought the email was a phishing attempt at first, so I changed my password immediately. I then sent a ticket to support regarding this and I am still awaiting a response.

Just to test this I downloaded and installed the client and tried to log on and I am indeed banned it seems. Not that I care entirely too much, as stated previously I have not played in quite some time preferring other games.

So mainly it's a curiosity thing and the fact that that this account is associated with me I need to know if it was accessed by a someone else.

I have searched the forums and it seems at times there has been waves of accidental bans, is this perhaps the case? I've never incurred an infraction nor smaller ban ever, I can't imagine what a permanent ban would require.

Thanks in advance for your reply


EDIT: What I have gathered is that support is lacking; for instance, I just posted this in support and it was deleted and suggested I post here as opposed to just moving the post... I posted in support originally because it is a support issue, a problem with an error... why would I post in player behavior and modification when I insist I did not misbehave.  The tone here is all wrong.

replies.body:
Hey Sickmind,

Your account was locked temporarily because we saw suspicious activity on it after a long period of inactivity.  Often we see less scrupulous people attempt to gain access to very old accounts which they then sell on the "black market" or use for botting purposes.  Since your account was level 6 it seems to me like they intended to turn it into a "bot" and mindlessly play games till 30 before they'll sell it to someone else.

Support will be able to recover the account for you once they reach your ticket.

What's the company policy on things like this? Is it alright to buy and sell accounts? If not what is the penalty I came across this on eBay was wondering. http://m.ebay.com/itm/S1-NA-League-of-Legends-Account-All-Champs-206-Skins-Rare-Gold-70k-IP-/282178504902?nav=SEARCH

Buying and Selling is against the rules and if caught would result in the account being permanently banned.  It can take a lot of forms, sometimes someone sells their own account, but often we see people level "botted" accounts to 30 and then sell to others.

We take action on these accounts because it's a really shitty experience for the people who had to play games with these accounts.  Usually the "bot" behavior isn't advance and just involves endlessly pushing a lane.  We've seen Co-Op Vs. AI games go terrible because these "bots" have fed the enemy team of AI's with their poor play.
AIs don't get gold from kills, though...

> [{quoted}](name=Cpt Jack Bird,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=1iYWRJd7,comment-id=0002000100000000,timestamp=2016-09-27T02:11:35.707+0000)
>
> AIs don't get gold from kills, though...

That's not the point. The point is that the bot accounts often make it allot more difficult for the newer/inexperienced players to win since the bot(s) that they're feeding will be able to out-damage anything the team of newer human players can dish out.

"We've seen Co-Op Vs. AI games go terrible because these "bots" have fed the enemy team of AI's with their poor play."

That is the point xD

The truth is they go terrible because it's effectively 4v5 or 3v5, not because the bots have fed the AIs.

I thought it was an amazing experience as grueling as it was. Many sleepless nights and about a bajillion sketches later I am actually pretty decent. I specialized in 3D but you are exposed all aspects from figure drawing, 2D animation, rigging, production, you touch on just about everything. The instructors are top notch professionals culled from the industry, I had teachers from Disney, Dreamworks, Pixar etc. As far as the job market goes it can be very competitive, since graduation I have been earning a living doing editing and motion graphics for the Ad and Film Industry, both things I picked up in school and I still use the principals of animation all the time. In hindsight because of how much advertising and film uses Motion Graphics I would have changed my major to that as opposed to just Animation personally, there is tons of money to be made in ads.

EDIT: I thoght the MOME (Motion Media) kids were way cooler to hang with then the Animation nerds lol. I'm a huge nerd... but woah it gets scary haha.

> there has been waves of accidental bans

People can't keep their own login information safe and get banned for other people doing things on their account, or they are cheating and lying about far more often than the ban was an accident. If you simply have not been playing and got banned, it's probably because your information got out (likely a phishing site or poor name/password choices) and your account was compromised.

> What I have gathered is that support is lacking

The Help & Support board is for technical issues. If you need help with an account inquiry (such as this) you need to submit a ticket, which you have, and be patient with getting a reply because it can take a few days depending on the backlog. Moderation is physically incapable of moving posts; the boards simply do not currently support that. The reason they wanted you to post in PB&M is because this is where you get insight into why you were banned (though just a ticket is the better course).
